channel.title: How I add this: member or nonmember...has been logged in?
channel.description:
How I add this u know When my account come logged in on my server it needs to say member....has been logged in and when your not a member it need to say nonmember...has been logged in..... please help!!!!!!!
Project Czar has got it to when you know what project Czar is.
I hope you can help me.

item.source: How I add this: member or nonmember...has been logged in?

item.title: How I add this: member or nonmember...has been logged in?
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

You’ll need to add something like this into your client class:

public boolean isMember = false;

Then you’ll have to make it save/load in the character files (I will not help with this, I’m sure there is a tutorial somewhere).

Then you can use this code in place of the message to all:

if(isMember){
    PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "Member "+playerName+" has logged in! There are now "+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount() + " players online.";
} else {
    PlayerHandler.messageToAll = "Non-member "+playerName+" has logged in! There are now "+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount() + " players online.";
}

Good luck with the character files and if you need any help with them feel free to ask me :).

Read full topic

There are now "+PlayerHandler.getPlayerCount() + " players online."; } you see I have this but I need member or nonmember…has been logged in the same as Project Czar

item.title: How I add this: member or nonmember...has been logged in?
item.dc:creator: @Graham Graham
item.description:
@Graham wrote:

You should find the code that sends a message to all players saying “x has logged in”.

You should also have a boolean in your client for the member flag.

Then do something like this (example code will not work):

if(is_member_flag)
{
    send_message_to_all_players("Member " + player_name + " has logged in.");
}
else
{
    send_message_to_all_players("Non-member " + player_name + " has logged in.");
}

Sorry I can’t give you real code that would work, but I don’t know enough about the source you are using and how you have set it up.

Good luck :).

Read full topic
